intro: Elleanthus macer, commonly known as the common elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Elleanthus macer is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun, making it a common sight in open grasslands and along roadsides.
